oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Letter from J. L. Swann to "Gordon's Followers"
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Letter from J. L. Swann to "Gordon's Followers." The letter was found in the Manning/McClanahan family smokehouse. The location is referred to as "Rural Retreat." He writes very clearly about his reasons for fighting for the South, noting that he never expects to own a negro but is fighting for the South & Southern rights. "Gordon's Followers" appears to be the followers of the abolitionist preacher Dr. Gordon, although his identity is not certain. Swann refers to Gordon's Followers as rebels.
